title: Improper Cleanup on Thrown Exception
overview: Often, when functions or loops become complicated, some level of resource cleanup is needed throughout execution. Exceptions can disturb the flow of the code and prevent the necessary cleanup from happening.
remediation: ::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:If one breaks from a loop or function by throwing an exception, make sure that cleanup happens or that you should exit the program. Use throwing exceptions sparsely.::
